citation.article-title: Desulfovibrio longreachii sp. nov., a sulfate-reducing bacterium isolated from the Great Artesian Basin of Australia.

p.s: Description of Desulfovibrio longreachii sp. nov.
Desulfovibrio longreachii (long.rea.chi.i. M.L.fgen. n. longreachii of Longreach; named after the town in Australia)
Vibroid cells 2-4 μm long and 0.5 μm diameter.
Motile by means of single monopolar flagellum.
The pH range is 5.5-8.5; optimum growth pH is 7-7.4.
The temperature range is 20-48°C with maximum below 55°C; optimum growth occurs at 37°C.
Reduces sulfate to produce sulfide in presence of lactate and pyruvate.
Growth on pyruvate and fumarate without sulfate.
The G + C content is 69±0.25% mol%.
Isolated from the water of a free-flowing bore of the Great Artesian Basin of Australia.
The type strain is AB16910a and has been deposited with Australian Culture of Microorganisms, University of Queensland, St.
Lucia, Brisbane, Queensland, Australia as strain ACM 3958.
